bool AllowedIncomingAgent (AgentCircuitData agent, bool isRootAgent, out string reason)
 Check to make sure this user has the ability to have an agent in this region. This checks whether they exist in the grid, whether they are banned from the region and more. It is called by the SimulationService in CreateAgent mainly.
bool AllowedIncomingTeleport (UUID userID, Vector3 Position, uint TeleportFlags, out Vector3 newPosition, out string reason)

bool AllowedOutgoingLocalTeleport (UUID userID, out string reason)
 Check to make sure the user is allowed to teleport within this region.
bool AllowedOutgoingRemoteTeleport (UUID userID, out string reason)
 Check to make sure the user can be teleporting out of the region to a remote region. If this is false, the user is denied the ability to leave the region at all.

Member Function Documentation

bool Aurora.Framework.ScenePermissions.AllowedIncomingAgent ( AgentCircuitData  agent,
bool  isRootAgent,
out string  reason 
)

Check to make sure this user has the ability to have an agent in this region. This checks whether they exist in the grid, whether they are banned from the region and more. It is called by the SimulationService in CreateAgent mainly.

Parameters:
agent The Agent that is coming in
isRootAgent Whether this agent will be a root agent
reason If it fails, this explains why they cannot enter
Returns:
Whether this user is allowed to have an agent in this region
bool Aurora.Framework.ScenePermissions.AllowedIncomingTeleport ( UUID  userID,
Vector3  Position,
uint  TeleportFlags,
out Vector3  newPosition,
out string  reason 
)

Check to see whether the user is actually in this region and then figure out if they can be where they want to be.

Parameters:
userID The user who is teleporting (can be either incoming from a remote region, or a local teleport)
Position The position the user has requested
newPosition The position the user is going to get
reason If the check fails, this will tell why
Returns:
Whether this user can teleport into/around this region
bool Aurora.Framework.ScenePermissions.AllowedOutgoingLocalTeleport ( UUID  userID,
out string  reason 
)

Check to make sure the user is allowed to teleport within this region.

Parameters:
userID The user that is attempting to leave
reason If this check fails, this is the reason why
Returns:
Whether the user is allowed to teleport locally
bool Aurora.Framework.ScenePermissions.AllowedOutgoingRemoteTeleport ( UUID  userID,
out string  reason 
)

Check to make sure the user can be teleporting out of the region to a remote region. If this is false, the user is denied the ability to leave the region at all.

Parameters:
userID The user that is attempting to leave the region
reason If this fails, this explains why it failed
Returns:
Whether the user is allowed to teleport to remote regions

UUID  userID

Check whether the specified user is allowed to copy the given inventory item from their own inventory.

bool Aurora.Framework.ScenePermissions.CanCreateObjectInventory ( int  invType,
UUID  objectID,
UUID  userID 
)

Check whether the specified user is allowed to directly create the given inventory type in a prim's inventory (e.g. the New Script button in the 1.21 Linden Lab client).

Parameters:
invType 
objectID 
userID 
Returns:
